articles.title: Jays to find out ALCS opponent tonight
articles.description: The Toronto Blue Jays will find out who they will play in the American League Championship Series after tonight's Game 5 of the Division Series between the Seattle Mariners and the Detroit Tigers.

articles.title: Healthy Chytil a key piece for Vancouver Canucks
articles.description: For the first time in more than six months, Filip Chytil played a regular-season NHL game in more on Thursday.

articles.title: Chytil scores two, Canucks dump Flames 5-1
articles.description: Filip Chytil scored twice and the Vancouver Canucks opened their season with a 5-1 victory over the visiting Calgary Flames on Thursday.

articles.title: Connor shines in season-opening loss to Stars
articles.description: The spotlight was on Jonathan Toews when the Winnipeg Jets stepped on the ice for their season opener against the Dallas Stars on Thursday.

articles.title: Winnipeg Jets drop opener to Dallas 5-4 as late rally falls short
articles.description: Kyle Connor's hat trick extended his NHL record, scoring in an 8th straight season-opening game, but it wasn't enough to overcome a 5-1 deficit.

articles.title: Rantanen’s three-point night lifts Stars past Jets
articles.description: Mikko Rantanen had a three-point season-opening outing with a goal and two assists in the Dallas Stars' 5-4 victory over the Winnipeg Jets on Thursday.

articles.title: Call of the Wilde: Montreal Canadiens dominate Detroit Red Wings 5-1 in home opener
articles.description: Montreal should not have been the fresher of the two teams, after travelling overnight after their loss to Toronto, but they were. Brian Wilde has more.

articles.title: ‘Relentless’ Ernie Clement and Blue Jays Oust Yankees From Division Series
articles.description: The versatile contact-oriented infielder extended his hot streak by sparking two rallies that helped elevate Toronto past its AL East rivals and into the ALCS.

articles.title: Apple Watch expands a potentially life-saving feature to millions more users
articles.description: The latest Apple Watch update brings hypertension notifications to Canada, joining over 150 countries where the feature can now alert users to potential signs of high blood pressure.

articles.title: Richard Hsiao: The new owner of Aris BC who sent fans into frenzy at the Alexandreio – A billionaire who loves basketball
articles.description:
The arrival of Aris BC’s new owner, Richard Hsiao, at the Alexandreio arena for the EuroCup game against Hamburg sparked an explosion of excitement among the team’s fans

articles.title: Did the Trump administration just side with Canada in a treaty dispute?
articles.description:
Lawrence Herman is an international lawyer with Herman & Associates and a senior fellow at the C.D. Howe Institute
We have become inured to the disdain of the Trump White House for international treaties and agreements as it wages trade wars against the world…

articles.title: Guru Studio launches True & the Rainbow Kingdom shorts on YouTube, expands to Roblox
articles.description: Toronto-based Guru Studio is launching a collection of shorts based on its animated preschool series True & the Rainbow Kingdom on YouTube and expanding the IP onto social gaming platform Roblox. T...

articles.title: U.S. bill calls for more integration between Canadian, American border agents
articles.description: The U.S. Congress is being asked to adopt legislation that could lead to Canada and the United States further integrating their enforcement of the border — including allowing U.S. officers to more freely operate on Canadian soil.

articles.title: Ontario needs to expand programming to strengthen bail system, report says
articles.description: On the heels of expected federal legislation aimed at revamping the bail system, a new report from the John Howard Society of Ontario is calling on the province add more bail beds and  expand the bail verification and supervision program across Ontario. Advoc…

articles.title: Slain gang leader extorted thousands from Montreal-area restaurateurs, documents show
articles.description: Financial records uncovered during a 2019 murder investigation detail what police say was a web of people, and seemingly restaurants, who owed hundreds of thousands of dollars to Charalambos Theologou, the organized crime kingpin shot dead at a Starbucks in L…

articles.title: Staff shortages leading to heart surgery delays and deaths, say Quebec cardiologists, surgeons
articles.description: Cardiologists and heart surgeons in Quebec are warning about a shortage of staff, particularly perfusionists, saying the lack of workers who help keep patients alive during heart surgeries is contributing to delays and even deaths.

articles.title: CBSA systems outage at Canada-U.S. border a 'big red flag,' says security expert
articles.description: Border officers told they're union the September IT outage may have led them to miss potential security flags at Canada-U.S. crossings. The CBSA says safety standards were upheld, but security experts call it a big risk.

articles.title: I feel both guilt and gratitude when I think of how hard my parents work to support me
articles.description: On a recent trip to Barcelona, medical student Keith Wong spotted a couple that reminded him of his hard-working Chinese Canadian parents, making him consider the fact that he took a vacation while his parents rarely do. He writes about balancing guilt, grati…

articles.title: With encampments spreading across Montreal, how will the next mayor respond?
articles.description: There are dozens of encampments across Montreal, highlighting gaps in services and fuelling debate over how the city should respond.
